perturbation.original_text:
(a) HCI shall pay MLX a guaranteed fixed sum of [*] US per annum during the
     Initial Term of this Agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment of [*]
     US (the "Monthly Payment"). This Monthly Payment shall be due by the 10th
     day of each month;
perturbation.changed_text:
(a) HCI shall pay MLX a guaranteed fixed sum of [*] US per annum during the
     Initial Term of this Agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment of [*]
     US (the "Monthly Payment"). This Monthly Payment shall be due by the 10th
     day of each month; however, if HCI provides a detailed report justifying a delay, the payment can be extended to the 25th day of the month.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the monthly payment is due by the 10th day of each month. The modified text adds a clause that allows HCI to extend the payment deadline to the 25th day of the month if they provide a report justifying the delay. This creates a conflict as the initial deadline is no longer absolute, leading to uncertainty in enforcement. If HCI can delay payment simply by providing a "report," this undermines the original payment terms.

perturbation.original_text:
Applicable remittances and accounting reports will follow under separate
     cover within sixty (60) days of the end of each quarter.
perturbation.changed_text:
Applicable remittances and accounting reports will follow under separate
     cover within sixty (60) days of the end of each quarter. However, if the report requires information from a third party, the deadline for submission will be extended indefinitely until that information is available.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that remittances and accounting reports will be provided within 60 days of the end of each quarter. The modified text adds a clause that allows for an indefinite extension of the deadline if the report requires information from a third party. This creates a contradiction, making the original deadline non-binding in certain circumstances and causing uncertainty. It would be difficult to determine when the clause is triggered, and would introduce uncertainty to enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
11.2  Termination
(a)  Either Party may terminate this Agreement upon 30 days prior written notice
     to the other Party if 1) such other Party breaches any material term of
     this Agreement, unless such breach is cured within 30 days; or 2) if any of
     the terms of this Agreement that require mutual approval are not mutually
     agreed to;
perturbation.changed_text:
11.2  Termination
(a)  Either Party may terminate this Agreement upon 30 days prior written notice
     to the other Party if 1) such other Party breaches any material term of
     this Agreement, unless such breach is cured within 30 days; however, for breaches related to content delivery, the cure period is extended to 90 days; or 2) if any of
     the terms of this Agreement that require mutual approval are not mutually
     agreed to;
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a 30-day cure period for breaches of material terms. The modified text introduces an exception, extending the cure period to 90 days for breaches specifically related to content delivery. This creates a contradiction, as it's unclear which cure period applies to breaches involving both content and other aspects of the agreement. This adds uncertainty in enforcement, allowing for arguments about which timeframe is valid.
